1.text: Remind yourself that difficult emotions are normal during self-quarantine.

2.text: Reach out to your doctor if you have questions or concerns.

3.text: Talk to your employer if you’re worried about loss of income.

4.text: Stay in touch with your friends and family.

5.text: Practice stress-relieving activities to help you relax.

6.text: Stay at least 6 feet (2 m) away from obviously sick people.

7.text: Wash your hands frequently when you’re in public areas.

8.text: Keep your hands away from your face as much as possible.

9.text: Cover your mouth and nose if you cough or sneeze.

10.text: Avoid crowded areas if you’re at high risk or if local health officials recommend it.

11.text: Get recommendations on social distancing from reputable public health websites.

12.text: Self-quarantine if you’ve been exposed to an infected person.

13.text: Call your doctor immediately if you suspect you’re sick.

14.text: Stay home for 14 days or as long as your doctor recommends.

15.text: Avoid contact with other people or animals as much as possible.

16.text: Wear a mask if you have to be around other people.

17.text: Wash your hands frequently with soap and warm water.

18.text: Cover your mouth and nose whenever you cough or sneeze.

19.text: Disinfect objects and surfaces you come into contact with.

20.text: Monitor your condition closely and get medical help if anything changes.

21.text: Ask your doctor if you can return home or if you need to be hospitalized.

22.text: Stay home unless you need to seek medical care.

23.text: Remain in your own room as much as possible if you share a home.

24.text: Wear a mask if you have to interact with other people.

25.text: Practice proper hygiene to prevent spreading your illness.

26.text: Call your doctor immediately if your symptoms change or get worse.

27.text: Work with your doctor to determine when you can leave isolation.
